title: Review Steering Documents (P-3): product.md, tech.md, structure.md
description:
Requesting approval for project-wide steering documents (P-3 prerequisite for Assignment 7):

**Documents Created:**

1. **product.md** (~350 lines)
   - Product vision and purpose: Transform SimpleMiner into playable Minecraft-like game with AI integration
   - 5 Product Principles: Minecraft Fidelity, JSON-First, KISS Over YAGNI, KADI Integration, Widget Pragmatism
   - Detailed feature descriptions for all 7 systems (Registry, Inventory, Mining/Placement, UI, AI Agents, Menu, Sound Effects)
   - 11 MVP validation items
   - Success metrics and non-goals

2. **tech.md** (~400 lines)
   - Core technologies: C++20, DirectX 11, MSVC 2022, Windows x64
   - Key dependencies: FMOD, Winsock2, nlohmann/json, KADI Broker, V8
   - Application architecture: Multi-threaded chunk system, registry pattern, entity-component
   - KADI WebSocket integration details (7-state connection, MCP tools with **PascalCase naming**)
   - **MCP Tools (PascalCase):**
     * SimpleMinerSpawnAgent(name, x, y, z)
     * SimpleMinerMoveAgent(agentID, dirX, dirY, dirZ, duration)
     * SimpleMinerMineBlock(agentID, x, y, z)
     * SimpleMinerPlaceBlock(agentID, blockType, x, y, z)
     * SimpleMinerGetAgentVision(agentID)
     * SimpleMinerGetAgentInventory(agentID)
     * SimpleMinerCraftItem(agentID, recipeID)
   - Technical decisions with rationale:
     * JSON over XML for registries
     * KADI WebSocket over direct API
     * Use existing WidgetSubsystem despite alpha quality
     * Command queue over goal-based AI
     * 2×2 crafting only (no 3×3 yet)
   - Known limitations and technical debt (WidgetSubsystem, single-threaded game logic, no multiplayer, KADI external dependency, Windows-only)
   - Performance requirements and bottlenecks

3. **structure.md** (~450 lines)
   - Complete directory tree with A7 new files marked
   - File naming conventions (PascalCase classes, camelCase variables, m_ prefix)
   - Code organization principles (SOLID, DI, composition over inheritance, const correctness)
   - Module boundaries and dependency rules (Engine → Game one-way only)
   - Layer architecture: Core Systems → Gameplay → UI → KADI Integration
   - A7-specific file additions (8 new files in Gameplay, 4 in Definition, 3 in UI, 2 in KADI)

**Changes in This Version:**
- ✅ **MCP Tool Naming**: Updated all tool names from snake_case (simpleminer_spawn_agent) to PascalCase (SimpleMinerSpawnAgent)
- ✅ **Consistency**: requirements.md and tech.md now use consistent PascalCase naming

**Alignment with Requirements:**
- All documents incorporate user feedback from requirements.md approval
- JSON-first approach emphasized (per user's 3 explicit requests)
- Sound effects included as FR-7 (per user request for AudioSystem integration)
- KADI WebSocket integration detailed with 7-state connection flow
- Widget system pragmatism acknowledged ("very rough" but functional)
- Prerequisites order clarified: P-1 in design.md, P-2 and P-3 before design.md
- **MCP tool names follow PascalCase convention per user request**

**Files to Review:**
- `.spec-workflow/steering/product.md`
- `.spec-workflow/steering/tech.md` (updated with PascalCase tool names)
- `.spec-workflow/steering/structure.md`

**Next Steps After Approval:**
- P-3 prerequisite will be complete
- Ready to create design.md for A7 (which includes P-1: rendering bug fix solution)
- Design phase can begin with full context from steering documents

**Note:** These steering documents are project-wide and will guide not only A7 but also future assignments (A8, A9, etc.). They establish the foundational principles and architecture for SimpleMiner's ongoing development.
